explanation: Agent A is correct. With #define OS_DEBUG(__VA_ARGS__) the invocation OS_DEBUG("...", errno, strerror(errno)); preprocesses to nothing leaving a null statement (a solitary ‘;’). That null statement is executed at runtime but has no effect and its removal would not change program behaviour in this build/configuration, which meets the definition of dead code in MISRA C 2023 Rule 2.2. (If this is intentional for production builds it requires an explicit justification/deviation or use of conditional compilation so the project as built does not contain such dead statements.)
